channel.title: Lifehacker
channel.description: Tips and downloads for getting things done
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site.

item.title: ​FileThis Is an Online Filing Cabinet for Your Digital Paperwork
item.description:
Dealing with bills, both digital and paper-based, is a chore. FileThis makes life easier by collecting together all of your electronic statement into one place.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mark Wilson

item.title: Make Sure You Don't Get the Worst Room with These Hotel Manager Tips
item.description:
Some people get upgraded to fancy suites in the hotel, others get sentenced to rooms near the elevator. If you want to avoid the worst rooms, heed these reservation tips from a hotel front desk supervisor.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: ​Ask Dr. Nerdlove: I'm In Love With My Best Friend's Sister
item.description:
Hello Internet! Welcome to Ask Dr. NerdLove, the only dating advice column that's short on bullshit, tall in wordcount, narrow of purpose and wide in vision.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Harris O'Malley on Kotaku, shared by Whitson Gordon to Lifehacker

item.title: Make Foolproof Fried Chicken by Precooking It Before Frying
item.description:
Here's our goal for fried chicken: A crispy, golden brown outside and a juicy, fully cooked-through inside. And here's our strategy: Precook the chicken in the oven before frying to easily achieve both.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: Stop Facebook and Other Companies from Using Your Web History for Ads
item.description:
We already knew that Facebook is tracking our every move on the web , just like everyone else is, but now the social network says it's going to use data from the other sites we visit and the apps we use to deliver more relevant ads. If you want to opt out of this enhanced behavioral targeting, there's a form for that.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: Deals: $5 Smartphone Cases, Cheap Shop-Vac, Starbucks, Awesome Juicer
item.description:
No matter what smartphone you own, you can probably find a $5 or $6 Rearth case for it today on their eBay storefront. [$5-$6 Rearth Cases]

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Shep McAllister, Commerce Team

item.title: Has Windows 8 Improved?
item.description:
Dear Lifehacker,
I'm not a fan of what Microsoft did with Windows 8, so I didn't upgrade when it came out. I've stuck with Windows 7 for the past two years, but I need a new laptop (not tablet) and they all come with Windows 8. Has it gotten any better? Can I avoid using the stupid Metro interface?

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Whitson Gordon

item.title: ​Just Gestures Brings Touch Screen-Style Gestures to Your Mouse
item.description:
Windows: With a touch screen computer or tablet, you can use gestures to interact with apps. Just Gestures lets you perform customizable gestures with your mouse in Windows.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mark Wilson

item.title: ​Banish Office 2013's ALL CAPS Ribbon Labels
item.description:
You may have noticed that Office 2013's ribbon bar labels appear in all caps. If you find this annoying, here's how to change it.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mark Wilson

item.title: Eight Stubborn Alcohol Myths, Debunked by Science
item.description:
The act of drinking alcohol is surrounded by myths. Whether it's the idea you can trick breathalyzers or the suggestion that caffeine sobers you up, let's debunk some of these misconceptions so we can actually enjoy our drinks.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: ​Intelligent Ringer Adjusts Your Ringtone Volume Based on Ambient Noise
item.description:
Android: You know the feeling: you're somewhere quiet and your ringtone is too loud, or you're in a crowd and it's too quiet. Intelligent Ringer addresses this problem by changing ringtone volume according to the level of ambient noise.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mark Wilson

item.title: 7 Siri Tricks You Might Not Know About
item.description:
Apple's voice-activated assistant is now a well-known personality in his/her own right, but unless you've taken the time to dig into all the features that Siri offers you might not realize just now capable it is (particularly since the arrival of iOS 7). Here are seven ways to get Siri working harder for you.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: David Nield on Field Guide, shared by Whitson Gordon to Lifehacker

item.title: Dayboard Uses Chrome's New Tab Page To Keep You Focused on Your To-Dos
item.description:
Chrome: Dayboard is a Chrome extension that turns every new tab page into a minimal to-do list that keeps you focused on the most important things on your agenda for the day. You choose the five most important things on your to-do list, and Dayboard makes sure they're front and center.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Alan Henry

item.title: Deadspin Pile Of Snow Makes Fantastic Save On Kings' Potential Game-Tying Goal | Gizmodo How Much Ph
item.description:
Deadspin Pile Of Snow Makes Fantastic Save On Kings' Potential Game-Tying Goal | Gizmodo How Much Physical Activity Do You Really Need? | io9 10 Real-Life Laws That Regulate The Supernatural World | Kotaku Disney Princesses, Dressed as Their Dude Companions

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Jessica Smith on Jessica, shared by Whitson Gordon to Lifehacker

item.title: Add an Aluminum Pan Opposite the Coals for Perfect Grilling
item.description:
The editors of Cook's Illustrated take their grilling seriously, and they're sharing their secret to uniform cooking: an aluminum baking pan with water, placed opposite the coals.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: Add a Rubber Band to Door Knobs to Soften Slamming Doors
item.description:
Everyone has those few doors which are prone to slamming loudly, whether at home or at the office. The trick to softening that noise? A simple rubber band, says Mashable.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: Amazon Unveils Amazon Prime Music, a New Ad-Free Streaming Service
item.description:
Amazon quietly took the wraps off of Amazon Prime Music this morning, a new ad-free streaming music service with over a million tracks in its database. You can stream on the web or listen on the go with the Amazon Music desktop, mobile, or web apps, and it's completely free for Prime subscribers.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Alan Henry

item.title: What's the Best Android Keyboard?
item.description:
One great thing about Android is that you can use whatever keyboard suits your needs. Custom dictionaries, themes, layouts, whatever you need, there's a keyboard to match. This week, we want to know which ones you think are the best.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Alan Henry

item.title: ContactBox Creates and Shares Custom Contact Lists
item.description:
Android/iOS: Want to give the numbers or emails of a few repairmen to your buddy? ContactBox is the easiest solution to create custom lists from your contacts and share them with others.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: The Best Non-Kitchen Tools You Should Have in Your Kitchen
item.description:
For most of us, a tool has to be really useful to earn a spot in our kitchen. That doesn't mean that kitchen space should be limited to cooking gadgets and uni-taskers though. Let's build a list of the best non-kitchen tools that work wonders when you're cooking. We'll get you started.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Alan Henry

item.title: Clean Out Your Wallet Before Traveling
item.description:
If you're preparing for a trip, business and financial advice blog Kiplinger recommends cleaning out your wallet of excess credit and debit cards, and keeping the ones you do take separate.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan

item.title: Gaze at the World's Landmarks with These Wallpapers
item.description:
If you can't travel the world, at least you can get a glimpse of its most majestic landmarks with these wallpapers.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Whitson Gordon

item.title: Why You Get Garlic Breath, and How to Get Rid of It
item.description:
Garlic is one of the most flavorful things on the Earth, but it makes your breath smell like death itself died in your mouth. This video from Reactions explains what causes garlic breath and how to make it disappear.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan

item.title: Gawker Guys Prank Their Housemate by Filling His Room With 2,000 Balloons | Gizmodo Star Wars and Sk
item.description:
Gawker Guys Prank Their Housemate by Filling His Room With 2,000 Balloons | Gizmodo Star Wars and Skateboarding Were Meant To Be Together | Jalopnik What Jerry Seinfeld Gets About The Internet That Most Don't | Jezebel If You Want to Stop Violence Against Women, Ban Men | Kinja Popular Posts

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Jessica Smith on io9, shared by Whitson Gordon to Lifehacker

item.title: Build a Network Caller ID LED Screen
item.description:
Caller ID works wonders when you're trying to dodge telemarketers, but you need to have the phone nearby. B Tod Cox decided to solve that problem with an LED screen you can set up in any room of the house.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan
